topics.body:
Here's something I just don't get thoguh about the video game market:
Why does the video game market have a fetish for fps games if fps games are not the top selling games, nor are they the top genre nor do they have the most online players.

Before someone goes "ermagod you hate fps games"; no I really don't, one of my top favorite games is FEAR and S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

Rather my point is that fps games are quickly going the way of what happened to MMO games; ten years ago MMO, WoW and such used to be king, but now they're second fiddle.  FPS games *total combined revenue* is going downhill sales wise and other franchises and genres are gaining popularity.  If you're wondering what I mean by this is that right now the action & puzzle genre are growing in popularity and becoming the new "in" thing.

The only real reason why I can guess fps games still get the majority of the attention is that those fps studios just don't know how to compete financially.

Tl:dr; ten years ago MMO games used to be the "in" thing; then the "in" thing was fps games; now the "in" thing is action and puzzle genre games.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a9969d636872396c1e0000#post_54a9969d636872396c1e0000
Its because of games like CoD, Like MMO's and how they all at a time were getting popular because of stuff like WoW pushing the them forward FPS games got a lot of attention cuz they wanted that CoD cash. or at least that's how I see it.

WoW was popular, LETS MAKE WoW GAMES, CoD is popular, LETS MAKE CoD GAMES. 

I can only imagine what the next craze will be, Can you imagine everyone wanting to make more Action games like Devil May Cry and Bayo? 

Or maybe more games like Gotcha Force?

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a997ec63687233133c0000#post_54a997ec63687233133c0000
There's a problem though. . LoL is the new most popular video game right now.

The problems with the video game industry trying to cash in on the LoL craze summarized:
1)*NOBODY CAN COMPETE IN THE MOBA GENRE WITH LoL*
2)Any and all attempts to compete with LoL have crashed and burned *hard*.
3)Until LoL eventually loses popularity, which probably won't be for ten years, nobody, not even Dota, can compete head on.
4)That means for the next ten years there's going to be a game as king of the industry that nobody can emulate/compete with or cash in on.

If you're confused what I mean by this is that think about how popular Call of Duty was; now imagine if during it's years as king there were next no other fps games at all being made.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a99aaa636872318d0f0100#post_54a99aaa636872318d0f0100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a99a256368723af8440000#post_54a99a256368723af8440000
Until Chernobyl happened and drained their resources.[/bq]
Not really; the USSR was never long term feasible because they overspent like crazy and their production and economy was never that large to begin with.

Before someone goes "well the usa is overspending"; I mean you're forgetting how low the gdp of russia is compared to the usa.  Russia's economy was always drastically lower than the usa's so if you get into a spending war with the usa you're going to financially die.
